info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 7 at 1:34AM CDT until June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County.
For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate.
* WHEN...From this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Happy Hollow Picnic Area floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 9.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage to 7.4 feet this afternoon. It will rise to 7.9 feet this evening. It will then fall to 3.9 feet Tuesday morning. It will rise to 4.0 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 02/29/1944. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
